family.parents: George Nelson Culver and Diana Louise Aikens
family.spouses: Unknown first wife (widowed by 1900); Alice M. Unknown (second wife, born c. 1871 in English-speaking Canada)
family.siblings: Otis Henry Culver, Emma Louise Culver, Inez Adel Culver

timeline.event: Living with his parents in Stockbridge
Living with his parents in Des Moines
Widowed journalist living in San Juan
Fred and Alice were living in San Juan; Fred was a newspaper manager
March 21: Died in Bellingham, WA after surgery

miscellaneous: Occupation: Journalist, newspaper manager. Co-owned the Islander (later San Juan Islander) newspaper with brother O.H. Culver. Had poor health from youth. Died after 5-hour surgery in Bellingham. His father Nelson wrote his obituary titled 'Ring the Bell Softly, There's Crepe on the Door.'
researchQuestions: What was Alice M.'s maiden name?
notes: Relatively sparse page with TBD content about wives
